intro: Ilex uniflora f. pastoensis, commonly known as the Pasto holly, is a compact evergreen shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It features small, glossy, dark green leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers in the spring, which are followed by bright red berries in the fall. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it suitable for shaded garden spaces. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often used in horticulture for landscaping purposes.
